p.s: The newspaper article Langauge learning in the UK: can't won't, don't, written by John Worne, on the 27 January 2015, in the Telegraph is about the development of language learning in the UK.
First John Worne describes the national view on speaking foreign languages with three words can't, won't, don't.
over the number of UK students which study foreign languages has been steady decline, says John Worne.
there are more languages on the plan and more primary schools, but the GCSE and A-level has stalled.
Most people think they don't mind and the future is mobile devices, like iPhones which translate everything you want.
But the author gives his opinion to that and says that this is Cobblers.
Language learning is important for UK's future.
It is important for their trades, prosperity, cultural exports, diplomacy and national security, so John Worne.
Not only this, more than two-thirds of UK businesses need for language skills.
The problem is, that the UK businesses trust the translators.
The author says that it is good universities are aluing students to study language alongside another degree subject.
A lawyer with language skills is more worth than a pure lawyer, it doesn't matter how good you are, says the author.
all in all the author says that foreign language learning in the UK is very important and must be better than now.
His personal view shows us that he criticisecriticises the school and education system.
There is only one really good thing, he says in line 24.
Moreover he is ana parent and he wants to create a better system for his and everyone elseelse's child.
